juzs.text: Blessed became That One in Whose Hand is the dominion, and He is All-Capable over every thing
That One Who created the death and the life, so that He may test you which one of you remained better in performance. And He is the All-Mighty, the Oft-Forgiving

That One Who created seven (or many) heavens (having) fields one beyond another. You do not see in the creation of Ar-Rahman any gap or break. So direct (your) vision (send this as beyond as possible). Do you see any cracks
Afterwards, direct the vision twice, the watching-light would rebound towards you unsuccessful (to penetrate the universe) and it (is) returned and checked
And surely, indeed We have adorned the nearest heaven with shining objects, and We have made them as stringent chasers against the devils. And We have prepared for them punishment of the blazing fire
And for those who have disbelieved in their Nourisher-Sustainer is the torment of Hell, and evil (it is as) a place of final return
When they are cast therein, they heard it roaring wildly and it comes in turmoil
It becomes (as if) it will burst up in rage. Every time a group is cast therein, its keeper put up a question unto them: “Did n't a warner come to you?”
They said: “Yes! Warner definitely came to us but we belied, and we said — 'Allah has not sent down any thing; you are not but in very great error.' ”
And they said: “Had we been listening or using intellect, we would not have been among the companions of the blazing Fire.”
So they confessed their sin. So (there is nothing except) despair and remoteness (from mercy) for the companions of the blazing Fire
Verily, those who are conscious of their Nourisher-Sustainer unseen — for them is forgiveness and a great reward
And whether you keep your talk secret or you make it loud — truly, He is All-Knower about the state of the chests
Does He not know one He has created ? And He is the Keenest Observer, the Most Well-Informed
He it is Who has made the earth even and smooth for you, so walk in its tracks and eat out of His provision; and to Him would be the Gathering of Resurrection
Have you attained security (against) That Who is in the heaven that He may cause the earth sink with you and at that time it may shake (being in earthquake)
Or have you attained security (against) That Who is in the heaven that He may direct against you a violent storm? Then very soon you will know how (terrible proved) My Warning
And surely, indeed, belied those who passed before these (people). Then how (terrible) was My rejection (for them)

Do they then not see the birds above them. They are those (who move) in rows (with spread out wings) and they (also) fold (their wings partially). Does not uphold them (any one) except Ar-Rahman. Surely, He is All-Seer of everything
So who is this: that one (that) he (becomes) an army unto you (and) he helps you, besides Ar-Rahman? The disbelievers are not but in delusion
So who is this: that one who will give you provision if He (Allah) withheld His provision? Nay! They continued obstinately in rebellion and aversion
So then that one who is grovelling on his face is better guided or he who walks upright on a Permanent Path
Say: “He it is Who has brought you into being, and bestowed unto you hearing, and the eyes and the hearts. Very little (it is) which you pay thanks.”
Say: “He it is Who multiplied you in the earth, and to Him shall you be gathered.”
And they say: “When (will get implemented) this promise (about Resurrection) — if you are those who speak the truth?”
Say: “Certainly what (is a fact is that) the knowledge (about this Event is) with Allah and surely what (is a fact is that) I (am only) a plain warner.”

So when they saw it approaching (on the Day of Judgment), went in extreme terror (and turmoil) the faces of those who disbelieved. And it was said (to them): “This is the Event you have been demanding of it.”
Say: “Have you thought over if Allah makes me dead and whosoever is with me, or He bestowed mercy on us — then who will rescue the disbelievers from the painful torment?”
Say: “He is Ar-Rahman, we have Believed in Him, and in Him we have put (our) trust. So, soon you will know who is he (that is) in manifest error.”
Say: “Have you (ever) thought over if your water in the early morning got sunk and lowered, then who will come to you with water, flowing (in the form of rivers, springs, wells or water-falls)?”
The pen and whatever people record in writing in straight lines become a witness,—
(that) you are not, by the Grace of your Nourisher-Sustainer, a fanatic
and surely, for you is indeed a reward not subjected to interruption
and surely, you indeed (stand) on a character of exalted standard
And very soon you will see, and they will (also) see —
with which of you (is the state of) being affected in test and tribulations
Verily, your Nourisher-Sustainer: He knows better who went astray from His Path, and He knows better those who stand guided
So obey not the deniers (of Al-Kitab)
They wished if you compromise (in Religion) then they (too) would compromise
And never obey any one who swears much, who has no regard for his integrity
one who is a slanderer, very active (in) defaming (others)
one who forbids anything desirable, one who is transgressor, one who repeatedly indulges in sins
one who is ill-mannered (violent, cruel, and misbehaves without reason), (and) over and above it (he is) one who has bad reputation
(such a personality he developed) because he became a possessor of wealth and sons
When Our Verses are recited unto him, he said: “Writings of the initial people!”
Soon We shall brand him (hot) over the nose

Verily, We have subjected them to retribution in the same way as We subjected to retribution the ‘owners of the garden’ when they swore: definitely they shall pluck its fruits (as soon as they are) those who face the dawn
and they make no exception or reservation [i.e., did not utter the words Insha Allaho (if Allah Willed]
Then moved over this (garden) a swiftly moving (torment) proceeding from your Nourisher-Sustainer while they were those who are asleep
so (the garden) became by the early dawn as one whose fruit is completely plucked out
Then they called out to one another (as soon as they were) those who face the dawn
that: “Move on to your tilth early morning if you be those who pluck the fruits. ”
So they moved, and they talk among themselves in low tone
that: “Shall not enter this (garden), this day, in your presence, any of the indigent one (who may expect a share in our produce).”
And they moved very early in the morning (thinhead of state themselves to be) those who are very capable over (implementing their desired) prohibition
But when they saw that (garden), they said: “Verily we are indeed those who have lost the track
Nay! We are those who stand deprived (of our own produce).”
One more just among them said: “Did I not tell you why don’t you glorify (Allah by adopting the teachings of His Al-Kitab) ?”
They said: “Glory be to our Nourisher-Sustainer! Surely we, we (ourselves) had been transgressors.”
Then some of them came face to face to some (others of them): they blame one another
They said: “Oh, woe to us! Surely we, we (ourselves) had been disobedient arrogants

May be our Nourisher-Sustainer (takes us in mercy and) that He may give instead (an orchard) better than that (which He decided to put in ruins). Truly we, to our Nourisher-Sustainer, (become) those who attach (themselves to His Path).”
Like this (comes) the punishment (from Allah in this very world); and indeed the punishment in the Hereafter is greater, provided the people had been knowing (such facts of existence)
Verily, for the Muttaqun: with their Nourisher-Sustainer (are) Gardens of Delight
Shall We then treat Al-Muslimun like Al-Mujrimun
What (is the matter) with you? How do you judge
Is for you a book in which you take lesson
Then certainly, for you therein is indeed (all such material) which you judge as better
Are unto you written therein commitments on My behalf extending to the Day of Resurrection — (that) certainly (are) in your interest, indeed, whatsoever you judge
Ask them, who of them stands as a surety for that
Or, for them are ‘partners’ (in the Dominion of Allah)? Then let them come with their ‘partners’ if they became those who speak the truth
The Day the covering is removed from the shin (i.e., a terror and anxiety is created in a person) and they are called towards prostrations (to Allah alone), but they do not have the capacity

Their eyes becoming in castdown position, humiliation covers them, and surely they used to be called towards prostrations while they were healthy and sound (but they avoided Prayers and bypassed the teachings of Allah’s Book)
So (now) leave Me (alone) and that who belies this Al-Hadees. Soon We shall draw them (near to destruction) step by step from whence they know not
And I give them respite; verily, My plan is very effective
Do you ask them a reward so that they from (such a) tax are those who are heavily burdened

Or with them is al-ghaib [‘the unseen’ (source of the Divine Knowledge)] so they write down (with their own hands ‘religious verdicts’, and giving them the title of hadees, associate them to Allah and the Prophet)
So wait with patience for the Decree of your Nourisher-Sustainer, and do not be like the companion of the fish when he cried out to Us while he was in deep sorrow
Had not a Grace from his Nourisher-Sustainer stringed him, indeed he would have been cast on the bare land along the shore and he would have been a reproved one
So his Nourisher-Sustainer chose him and regarded him of the righteous

And if those who have disbelieved could, they indeed would have made you slip (off the Path) by (the mischievous glance of) their eyes as and when they heard Az-Zikr and they will say: “Verily, he is a fanatic.”
Although it is not but Zikrun-lil-alamin (‘Message to the worlds’)
The Reality
What (is) the Reality
And what made you realise what is the Reality
Samud and ‘Ad (people) denied Al-Qariah (The Disaster)
So as for Samud — they were destroyed by the awful cry
And as for ‘Ad, — they were destroyed by a wind, furious (and) violent

(Allah) imposed it on them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you see the (whole) nation therein lifeless as if they are (hollow) trunks of date-palm — those which fall down (themselves)
So do you see regarding them any remnants
And approached Firaun and whoever (went) before him, and the habitations that indulged in forgery — in (a state of) sin
So they disobeyed the Messenger of their Nourisher-Sustainer, so He seized them in a severe seizure
Surely We, when the water rose beyond limits, We carried you in the Ark (of Prophet Nuh)
so that We may establish this (extra-ordinary incident) unto you (O entire mankind!) as a Reminder and the retaining ears may retain it (in memory)
And when the siren is blown with one blowing (i.e., the first one)
and the earth and the mountains are lifted, then both got crushed in a single break-up
So this Day has really occurred the Inevitable (event of Resurrection)
And the heaven has developed cracks, so this Day it is torn-up
And the angels are on its limits. And bear the Throne of your Nourisher-Sustainer over themselves, this Day, eight (angels)
This Day, you will be brought (to your Rabb for final accountability and Judgment). Will not remain hidden any secret of you people
Then as for that who is handed over his record (of deeds) in his right (hand) — so he will say: “Alright, come! Read my that record
Surely I, I thought that I am one who will face my that accountability.”
So he (i.e., such a person who remained conscious of accountability is) in a happy life, well pleasing
in a Garden, rising-one
clusters of fruits whereof coming down and low (for easy reach)
Eat and drink joyfully because of what you already sent before in the days gone-by
And as for him who is handed over his record (of deeds) in his left (side) — so he will say: “O, would that, I had not been given my that record (which I did in my worldly life)
and I had not known what (would be) my that accountability (which has disgraced me)
O! Would that (death) had been one that makes things finally closed
Has not benefited me my that wealth (which I acquired in the world by foul means)
Has deserted me my that authority (which I misused in the world).”
(His brooding shall be interrupted thus): “Seize him and fetter him
afterwards throw him in the blazing Fire
then fasten him in a chain — the length thereof is seventy cubits!”
Verily, He used not to Believe in Allah, the Most High
and urged not for the food to the indigent
So (there is) not for him, this Day over-here a sincere and devoted friend
and nor food except out of the washings
Drink it not except the sinners
So beware! I do call to witness what you see
and what you see not
Certainly this (Al-Qur‘an or Al-Kitab) is indeed Qawl-o-Rasulin Karim (Utterance of an honoured Messenger)
And it is not (the) word of a poet; little is that you Believe
And nor (is it) the word of a clairvoyant; little (is that) which you remind (yourself and others)
(This is) a Descent proceeding from Nourisher-Sustainer of the worlds
And if he had uttered some of the sayings relating these to Us (i.e., mahead of state these narrations binding for the Believers) —
(then) surely, We would have seized him with (his) right (side)
(and) afterwards, surely We would have cut off from him (his) life-artery
Then (There would have been) not any one out of you as those who become an obstruction against that (punishment)
And without doubt this (Al-Kitab is) indeed, (the only) Tazkiratun-lil-Muttaqin (‘Reminder for the righteous)
And verily We, indeed We know that amongst you (are) those who deny (this status for Allah’s Scripture)
And undoubtedly it certainly (is a source of) disappointment for the disbelievers
And surely, it is indeed Haqq-ul-Yaqin (‘A certain Truth’)
So glorify the name of your Nourisher-Sustainer, the Most High
A questioner asked concerning a torment about to befall —
upon the disbelievers, (there is) not, unto it one who can avert (it) —
(since it is coming) from Allah, controller of the ascents
The angels and the Ar-Ruh ascend to Him in an aeon the measure whereof is fifty thousand years
So have patience — a beautiful patience
Verily, they see it (i.e., the torment about to befall) as something extremely remote
while We see it very near
The Day the sky becomes like the superficial flim of boiling oil
and the mountains become like flakes of wool
and does not ask a deeply devoted friend for (his) deeply devoted friend
People would be made to watch one another. The sinner would desire that he may pay a ransom to get rid of the torment that Day by (offering) his sons (in ransom)
and his consort, and his brother
and his kinfolks who sheltered him
and whosoever is on the earth — altogether, then (thus) he may redeem himself
By no means! Surely that (would be) a furiously flaming, blazing Fire —
one that strips off the skin
It (i.e., the blazing Fire invites) that who turned his back (to) and moved away (from Al-Kitab)
and hoarded (wealth) and withheld it (from spending it in accordance with the dictates of his conscience and the Scripture)
Verily, a human being: (as if) he is created impatient
When Ash-shar (harm) touched him, (he is one) who is extremely disturbed
And when Al-Khair (good) touched him, (he is one) who hesitates (himself) and also stops others (from spending it in a desirable way) —
except those who adhere to canonical Prayers
those people who: they are constant in offering their Prayers
and those: in their wealth is a well-known share —
for one who is compelled to ask and that who stands deprived (of the bare needs)
and those who Believe and testify the Day of Accountability and Judgment
and those who: they are ever mindful of the torment of their Nourisher-Sustainer
surely, the torment of their Nourisher-Sustainer (is) not an event that one may feel secure against it
and those who: they, regarding their private sexual parts are protectors —

except unto their wives or ma-malakat-aimanuhum (the women who are given in guardianship of adult males as their wives under a document prepared by the Muslim state) — then surely they are unblamed people
But whosoever sought beyond that then those people: they very ones are those who break the limits
And those: they, regarding the trusts with them, and promises with them, (behave as) those who implement with responsibility
and those — they stand firm on their testimonies (till the judgment in the case)
and those — they, over their Prayers act as guards
such a people would dwell in the Gardens (of Paradise) as honoured people
Then what (is the matter) with those who have disbelieved; in front of you they are those who swiftly move hither and thither (without paying attention to the teachings you propagate)
from the right (side) and from the left side in splinter groups
Does every man of them wish that he may be allowed entry in the Garden of delight
By no means! Verily We, We created them out of that which they know
So nay! I (i.e., Allah) bring as Witness the Rabb (Nourisher-Sustainer) of the easts and the wests. Surely We are, indeed, All-Capable Ones —
over (this) that We replace (them by people) better than them; and We are not those who are outrun
So leave them, they will indulge in vain talk and would play and sport until they have met their Day which they have been promised
The Day they will come out of the burial sites swiftly, as if they hasten on (and race) to a fixed target
their eyes adopting low-down position (in humility, fear and lamentation), ignominy (and disgrace) covers them. This is the Day which they had been promised
Verily, We, We sent Nuh to his nation (saying) that: “Warn your nation prior to (the stage) that comes to them a painful torment.”
He said: “O my nation! Verily, I am unto you a plain warner
so that you may pay obedience to Allah and remain mindful of Him, and obey me
He will forgive you of your sins and respite you to an appointed term. Surely, the term specified by Allah — when it has approached — it is not postponed if you had been knowing (these facts).”
(Nuh) said: “My Nourisher-Sustainer! Surely, I have invited my nation (to Your Scripture) night and day
But my preaching (and propagation) has not increased them except in flight

And truly I, every time I called them that You may forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears, and covered themselves up with their garments and insisted (on their wrong beliefs) and behaved with pride in arrogance, patronising seriously arrogant pride
Afterwards, surely I,I invited them with full force
Then surely I, I proclaimed to them in public, and (also) kept it private to them in secrecy
so I said (to them) : ask forgiveness from your Nourisher-Sustainer; certainly He is Oft-Forgiving
He will direct the sky unto you (to behave as one) which rains heavily
and He would strengthen you with wealth and sons, and would establish for you gardens and set for you rivers
What (is the matter) with you, you do not expect for Allah an absolute status
Although, indeed He created you through diverse stages
Have you not seen how Allah has brought into existence seven (or many) heavens, (having) fields one beyond another
and has set the moon therein as a light and made the sun (as) a radiant bright light
And Allah made you grow (initially) from the earth as a growth
Then He returns you therein, and will take you out in a new appearance (on the Day of Resurrection)
And Allah has made for you the earth wide spread and levelled
that you may traverse some of it through tracks, wide and open
Nuh said: “My Nourisher-Sustainer! Surely, they have disobeyed me, and they have followed one: his wealth and his children have not increased him except loss-wise
And they have devised an stratagem — a mighty plot
And they have said: ‘you shall not leave your gods; and nor you shall leave Wadd and nor Suwa’; and nor Yagus and Ya‘uq and Nasr
And indeed they have led astray many. And grant no increase to the transgressors except straying away (even further).”
Because of their sins they were drowned; then they were to enter the Fire. Then they did not find for themselves besides Allah, (any of the) helpers
And Nuh said: “My Nourisher-Sustainer! Do not leave (alive) on the (face of the) earth, out of the disbelievers, (any) inhabitant
Surely You! If You leave them, they will misguide Your Ibad; and they will not beget except a sinner, a disbeliever

My Nourisher-Sustainer! Grant forgiveness for me and my two parents, and for that who entered my home as a Believer, and for the Believing males and the Believing females (at large). And do not increase the transgressors except destruction-wise.”

Say: “It has been revealed to me that it (is so) — Nafar (a group of three to ten in number) of jinns has listened (to the Word of Allah) then said: ‘Surely we, we have listened Quranan Ajaban (‘a Wonderful Reading’)
It guides to the Right Path, so we have Believed therein; and we shall never associate as partner with our Nourisher-Sustainer any one
And that He: becomes exalted and high the Majesty of our Nourisher-Sustainer. He has not taken a wife and nor a son
And that the foolish among us used to utter against Allah extravagant lies
And verily we, we thought that a human being and a jinn would never utter a lie against Allah
And that it (is so): the men out of mankind used to take shelter with the Rijal (male adults) among jinns, so they increased them in arrogance
And that they: (the misled humans) they thought as you (Jinns) thought that Allah will never raise any one (as a Messenger cum Prophet)
And that we, indeed we touched the heaven, so we found it heavily filled up with stringent military guards and firing, shooting missiles
And that we used to sit on some of its seats for tapping the information; but any one who listens in the current circumstances, he will find for him a firing and shooting missile waiting in ambush
And that we: we do not assess whether evil is intended for those on earth, or their Nourisher-Sustainer has intended unto them something highly desirable
And that we: out of us (some are) righteous, and out of us (some are) contrary to that; we have become sects or tracks different and conflicting (in views)
And that we: we have (now) realised that we would never frustrate Allah (in His plan) concerning the earth; and we would never frustrate Him through flight (from His Dominion)

And that we: when we listened to Al-Hudah (‘The Guidance’), we developed Faith therein. And whosoever Believes in his Nourisher-Sustainer, then he fears not of any decrease (in reward), and nor arrogance (regarding punishment)

And that we: out of us (some are) Muslims, and out of us are Al-Qasitun (unjust people, who disobey the Desired Path). So whosoever embraced Islam, then those people have selected,out of their free will something highly desireable. ”
And as for Al-Qasitun: so they became firewood (or fuel) for Hell
And that if they had stood constantly on the (Desired) Path, indeed We would have given them to drink water in abundance —
so that We may test and assess them therein. And whoever disengages (himself) from Zikr of his Nourisher-Sustainer, He will make him slide in to a rising punishment
And that the Mosques are dedicated to Allah (alone). So don’t invoke alongwith Allah any one

And that it (i.e., the situation is like this): when Abdullah (a human subject of Allah) stood — he invokes Him (Alone, in Prayer), they (who do not accept the absolute Oneness of Allah) almost became (as if) they are becoming unto him an overpowering crowd
Tell (them): “Certainly what (is true is that) I do invoke my Nourisher-Sustainer, and I do not associate in partnership to Him any one.”
Tell (them): “Surely I, I do not own (any) harm regarding you, and nor something very desirable.”
Tell (them): “Certainly I: will never protect me against Allah, any one; and I will never find besides Him a place of refuge —
except propagation (coming) from Allah and His Messages. And whosoever will disobey Allah and His Messenger, then surely, for him is the Fire of Hell. (They would be) abiders therein forever.”
Until when they have seen what they are being promised, then soon they will understand who is a weaker helper and lesser number-wise
Tell (them): “I know not whether it is very near what you are promised, or my Nourisher-Sustainer sets for it a distant term.”
(He alone is) the All-Knower of al-ghaib (the unseen). So He does not make informed about His ghaib any one —
except whom He agreed out of a Messenger. Then surely He drives and moves in between his two hands (i.e., forward, in front of him) and on his back (invisible angel-escorts) as body- guards

so that He may know that they have indeed propagated Risalaat (‘Messages’.) of their Nourisher-Sustainer. And He kept in surveillance whatever (remained) with them, and He counted each and every thing number-wise
O you Al-Muzzammil [a person who devotes himself (to the Scripture) in missionary spirit, and is a trainee student
Keep standing (in Prayer) through the night except a small portion (which you may utilize for rest and sleep)
(e., you stand during the later) half of it or delete from it a little (and add it to your rest and sleep portion)

or increase (a little) over it (for adding it to the portion passed in Prayer), and reveal (recite and reproduce) Al-Quran in portions, slowly and distinctly, in a voice neither loud nor inaudible, with due regard to the arrangement and order (of its Text)
Verily We, soon We will transfer unto you (into your heart) a weighty statement

Without doubt, the rising up during the night (from sleep): this (is) more potent an exercise (for training the Nafs or Ruh) and more retaining for the statement (or Message recited from the Scripture)
truly for you, during the day-time is prolonged (or never-ending) chain of engagements
And propogate the Name of your Nourisher-Sustainer and devote to Him in full devotion
Nourisher-Sustainer for the east and the west; La-ilaha-illa-Huwa. So take Him (alone) as Wakil
And show patience on what people comment and keep away from them in a decent parting
And leave Me and the deniers who possess luxuries, and grant them respite for a while (i.e., till death approaches them and then they await the Accountability)
Surely, with Us are fetters, and a raging Fire
and a food which gets blocked in the throat, and a very painful torment
The Day the earth and the mountains shake violently, and the mountains became a heap of sand crumbling down
Surely, We have sent unto you a Messenger as a witness over you in the same way as We sent a Messenger unto Firaun
Then Firaun disobeyed the Messenger, so We seized him in a terrible catch
Then how would you guard against the (punishment of the) Day, if you disbelieved, that will make the children and youth grey-haired
With (the approach of) that (Day) the heaven is one which is about to break-up. His Promise has become fulfilled
Certainly, this is Tazkirah (‘Admonition’.), therefore whosoever wished, he adopted the Path leading to his Nourisher-Sustainer

Surely, your Nourisher-Sustainer comes to know that you continue to stand (in late-night Prayer) a little less than 2/3rd of the night, and (sometimes) half of it (i.e., the later half of the night), and (sometimes) one third (1/3rd) of it (i.e., the terminal 1/3rd of the night if we count the period from sunset to the break of dawn) — and a group out of those (Believers) who are with you (also join you in Tahajjud Prayers). And Allah assesses the (utility of the) night and the day. He knew (beforehand) that you will never bear it (without getting over-tired), so He has turned to you in affection. So recite as became easy, out of Al-Qur‘an. He knew that soon there would be among you sick people, and others will travel through the earth, they will seek out of the Bounty of Allah; and (still) others will take part in Qital for the Cause of Allah. So recite as became easy out of it and establish As-Salat and pay-up Zakat, and lend to Allah Qarzan Hasanan. And whatever you send in advance for yourselves in the form of Khair (commendable deeds), you will find it with Allah; it (will be) something extremely good and greater as a reward. And seek Forgiveness from Allah. Verily, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, continuously Merciful
O you Al-Muddassir
Take a stand, then warn (your people)
And your Nourisher-Sustainer: so glorify and magnify (Him by establishing the proper status to Allah and His Al-Kitab)
And your garments: so cleanse (them)
And uncleanliness: so avoid (that)
And bestow not favours (on some one with expectations that) you get extra (reward in return)
And regarding (the Code of life prescribed by) your Nourisher-Sustainer: so be steadfast
Then when is blown in the trumpet
Then that, this Day is a distressful day —
for the disbelievers, not (at all) an easy one
Leave Me and that whom I created as one individual
and sanctioned for him extended provision
and sons ever present
and set for him abode in the form of a fine, luxurious resting place
after (all this) he desires that I may (still) increase (his status and possessions)
By no means! Surely he had been, regarding Ayaatina a stubborn opponent
Soon I subject him to an overwhelming hardship
Surely, he thought over and assessed (a plan against Al-Kitab)
So, he has been condemned. How he assessed (and plotted)
Again, he has been destroyed.How he assessed (and plotted)
Then he looked (all around to create a psychological atmosphere through his expressions)
Then he frowned and scowled
Then he took an about-turn and behaved disdainfully
Then he said: “It is nothing but magic being accepted (since times gone-by)
It is nothing but a statement of a human being.”
Soon I cast him in Saqar (Hell-Fire)
And what made you realise what (is meant by) Saqar
It spares not (any condemned person), and nor leaves (him unburnt)
one that completely burns and dissolves the skin of a human being
Over it (are) nineteen

And We did not appoint the guardians of the Fire but angels; and We did not fix their number (which is 19) except as a test for the people who have disbelieved — in order that those who have been given Al-Kitab may develop certainty in Faith; and may increase Faith-wise those who have Believed; and may not harbour doubts and suspicions (in Al-Kitab) those who are given Al-Kitab and those who have already become Believers; and so that those in whose hearts is sickness and the disbelievers may comment: “What is that which Allah intended with the help of this example?” Thus Allah lets one go astray whom He thinks proper and gives guidance whom He thinks proper. And does not comprehend the forces of your Nourisher-Sustainer except He (Himself,). And this is not but zikrah (reminder) for man
Nay! The moon is a witness
The night is a witness when it retreated
Dawn is a witness when it brightened
Surely this (phenomenon of Revelation) is indeed one of the major (events) —
a warning for man —
for that of you who desired that he should advance or he should hang back and await
Every Nafs because of what she earned (remains) mortgaged
except companions of the right (side)
In Gardens — they will ask questions to one another —
unto the sinners
“What has caused you to enter Saqar?”
They said : “We were not of those who offer Prayers regularly
and we used not to feed the indigent
and we used to talk uselessly alongwith those who indulge in senseless talhead of state
and we used to deny the Day of Judgment
until there came to us the Certainty (i.e., the moment of death).”
So, would not benefit them the intercession of the intercessors
Then what (is wrong) with them — from At-Tazkirah (‘The Admonition’.) they are those who remain at a distance
As if they (are) frightened donkeys
who have fled (out of fear) from a group of lions
Nay! Every man of them desires that he may be given Suhuf (booklets) Munashsharah (spread out)
By no means! Nay, they are not mindful of the Hereafter
By no means (it benefits them)! Surely this is Tazkirah
So whosoever desired he reminded it (to himself and to others)
They will not remind (their ownselves or others) except that Allah desires (this). He (Alone is) worthy of (receiving) obedience and worthy for (granting) Forgiveness
Nay! I bring as witness the Day of Resurrection
And, Nay! I bring to witness the self-censuring Nafs (self)
Does a human being assess that We shall never assemble his bones
Of course, (We are) Capable Ones over (this) that We align perfectly (even) his finger-tips
Of course, a human being intends that he may commit sins prior to that (Day of Resurrection)
(That is why) he asks: “When (will be this) Day of Resurrection
So, when the sight is dazed
and the moon went in eclipse
and the sun and the moon got joined to one another; (or got withdrawn from their orbits)
that Day the human being will say: “Where is the place of escape and then refuge
By no means! (Today, there is) no place of hiding or refuge
Towards your Nourisher-Sustainer, this Day, (is) the place of stay
On that Day, the human being would be informed about what he sent forward, and what he left behind
Nay! The human being is a watch over his own Nafs
even if he put forward his excuses (regarding ignorance of the law of God)
Move not your tongue with it that you may make haste in memorising it (while this Al-Kitab is being inspired unto you)
Surely, on Us is the duty for its collection and its recitation
so when We have recited it, then adopt its recitation
Further on, indeed, on Us (is to provide) its explanation (within its Text)
By no means! (Your life becomes successful only by adopting the Book of Allah). Nay! You people develop love with the immediate life
and you people overlook the Hereafter
Some faces that Day (would be) shining and radiant
loohead of state forward to (the meeting with) their Nourisher-Sustainer
And (some) faces this Day (would be) Basirah (pale,and gloomy) —
(such a Nafs thinks) that a back-breahead of state event (as punishment) is to be done with her
Nay! When (the soul of a dying person) has already reached the Taraqiya [this is a plural-word which refers to the Throats, collar-bones or the epi-sternum]
And it is cried out: “Who (would act as a) Raaqq (Talismanical restorer, witch-doctor and magic-healer)?”
And he (i.e., the dying-person or his attendant or relative) became sure that it is Al-Firaq (the Departure)
And the calf (of one side) came closer to the calf (of the other side)
To your Nourisher-Sustainer, this Day, (is) the shifting-process
So (the disbelieving, hypocrite) did not testify (Al-Kitab) and did not offer Prayers
But (on the contrary) he belied (the Scripture) and bypassed (it)
then he walked to his family and followers — he exhibits pride and arrogance
Woe to you (who feel self-pride in hypocrisy and disbelief)! So (again) woe (to you)
Another time, woe to you! So (again) woe (to you)
Does the human personality think that he will be left Suda (untamed, uncontrolled and un-accounted for)
Was he not a Nutfah contained in the semen poured forth
Afterwards he became ‘Alaqatan. Then He differentiated (it) into a creation, and shaped and fashioned (him) in proportion
Then He made out of that (partially differentiated, vaguely evident foetal-mass) two different sexes — the male and the female
Is not This (One) Capable over that He may revive the dead
Has there passed over the human being a portion from the passing time when he becomes not an item mentioned (to somebody)
Surely, We created the human being out of Nutfah mixed (with male and female discharge). We (put him to test and trial as We) test him. So We made him (as) one who hears (and) one who sees
Verily, We guided him to The Path, whether (he be) grateful, and whether (he be) ungrateful
Truly, We have arranged for the disbelievers iron chains, iron collars and a blazing Fire
Surely Al-Abrar shall drink from (the contents of) a cup whose component (would be) camphor
(its source being) a spring: Ibad of Allah shall have a drink thereof; they will make it gush forth — flowing with full force
They (had been such people who) implement (their) vows, and they fear a Day whose evil (would be) widespread
and they provide the food, out of love and regard for Him to the indigent, and orphan or weak and a captive
(saying): “Surely, what (is a fact is that) we feed you for the attention and pleasure of Allah. We do not wish from you anything in exchange as a reward, and nor thanks
Verily, we fear from our Nourisher-Sustainer a Day extremely distressful, tremendously horrible.”
So Allah saved them from the evil of that Day and He provided them cheerfulness and joy
And their reward because of that which they bore in patience (would be) Garden and (raiments of) silk
Reclining ones therein on sofas. They shall not experience therein (the presence of the) sun, and nor excessive or bitter cold
And the shades thereof (are as if) coming down over them; and the clusters (of fruits) thereof have been made to come down (over them) to an extreme lowering
And repeatedly will be passed over them vessels (and jugs made) of silver and cups (which) appeared (like) crystals
crystals of silver. They took a measure of it measuring (it as they desired)
And they would be made to drink therein a cup whose one component came to be ginger
A spring therein (fills this cup). It has been allotted the name Salsabil
And will move all around them boys (of everlasting youthful freshness). When you noticed them you assessed them scattered pearls
And when you noticed, then and there, you noticed delights and a tremendous dominion
Over them, overgarments of Sundus (fine silk) and Istabraq (brocade). And they would be adorned with bracelets of silver; and their Nourisher-Sustainer made them drink a purified, sanctified drink
(They will be told): “Truly, this became unto you a reward, and your endeavour stands appreciated and fully thanked.”
Verily We, We, We have sent down unto you Al-Quran descending gradually (in portions, and after intervals)
So be steadfast regarding Hukm (‘Ordainment’) of your Nourisher-Sustainer; and do not obey among them a sinner or a disbeliever
And remind (yourself and remind others) the Name of your Nourisher-Sustainer (in the) morning and the late-afternoon (in your Fajr and Asr Prayers)

And in a portion of the night: so prostrate for Him and glorify Him long night through — (at the start of the night in Maghrib Prayer, at the darkness of the night in Isha Prayer, and in late or terminal part of the night in supererogatory Tahajjud Prayer)

Surely, all these contemporary people intensely desire the swiftly passing event (i.e., the life-span of this immediate world), and they overlook behind them a heavy Day (i.e., the Day of Accountability)
We, We have created them and We strengthened their bony-joints. And whenever We thought proper We brought in (their) place similar to them as a complete replacement
Certainly, this is Tazkirah. So whoever desired he picked up the path towards his Nourisher-Sustainer
And you desire not except if Allah (so) wills. Verily, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise
He admits to whom He thinks proper in His Mercy. And the transgressors — He has established for them a painful torment
Act as a witness those personalities who are sent forth and are well-known
So, the personalities who perform with full force and capacity — in full force and capacity
And the personalities who broadcast (the Message of Allah) in full broadcast
So, the personalities that make manifest the difference (between right and wrong, Light and darkness, and knowledge and ignorance) in complete separation
So, the personalities that bring to view right in front, (the) Zikr (‘Message’) —
as an excuse (i.e., performance of duty) or as a warning
Surely, whatever you are promised (through the above personalities) indeed (that is) something which must happen
So, when the stars are made to lose their light
and when the heaven is made to develop cracks
and when the mountains are broken and scattered as dust and debris
and when the Messengers are called together on the specified time
For what Day the term stood specified
For the Day of sorting out (Youmul Fasl)
And what explained you what is Youmul Fasl
Woe that Day to the deniers (of Al-Kitab, and the Last Day)
Did We not destroy the initial people
Then We bring in their place of authority, some later people
Thus do We deal with the transgressors
Woe that Day to the deniers
Did We not create you from an insignificant fluid
Then We placed it in the site of gestation —
for a well-known term (of pregnancy)
Then We assessed and determined (the various stages and processes of intra-uterine life and the signals for delivery); then (We proved to be) the excellent Assessors and those Who determine
Woe that Day to the deniers
Have We not made the earth as a den of storage —
for the living ones, and the dead ones
And We placed therein mountains firmly fixed and rising high. And We made you drink water, sweet and palatable
Woe that Day to the deniers
(It will be announced to the disbelievers on that Day): Proceed towards what you had been denying thereof
Proceed to a shadow possessing three compartments
not one providing deep shade and nor it gives protection against the fierce flame of Fire
Verily, it (i.e., the Hell) throws about sparks simulating a (huge) castle
as if those are camels in groups, of light yellow colour
Woe that Day to the deniers
This becomes the Day — they shall not speak
and nor permission shall be granted unto them so that they may bring some excuse
Woe that Day to the deniers
This is the Day of Decision (Youmul Fasl); We have collected you (altogether) as well as the initial people (alongwith you)
So if a plot became (of some benefit) for you, then prepare against Me
Woe that Day to the deniers
Verily, Al-Muttaqun shall be amidst shades and springs
and fruits out of that which they may desire
Eat and drink in happiness and joy because of what you had been doing (in your worldly life)
Verily, We — thus We reward Al-Muhsinun
Woe that Day to the deniers
(O you who are heedless to the Book of Allah in your day to day affairs in the world)! Eat and be benefited a little. Verily, you are Mujrimun
Woe that Day to the deniers
And when it is asked of them: “Bow down (to Allah)”, they will not bow down
Woe that Day to the deniers
Then in what Hadees after this (Al-Kitab) they will develop (their) Faith
